title: First State National Historical Park: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety        Ramsey House. NPS   Â    First State National Historical Park is a new national park unit. Programming and facilities are currently operated through our partners, especially the State of Delaware. Be aware that land within First State NHP is a mix of federal, state, and city land. Be careful crossing streets. Lock all valuables out of sight in your car. For more information, contact the individual sites below.  The New Castle Court House Museum and The Green, New Castle  211 Delaware St., New Castle, DE. (302) 323-4453 http://history.delaware.gov/museums/ncch/ncch_main.shtml  The Green, Dover 121 Martin Luther King, Jr. Blvd., Dover, DE.; (302) 739-9194 http://www.destateparks.com/park/first-state-heritage/index.asp  Beaver Valley  4501 Thompson Bridge Rd., Wilmington, DE; (302) 577-7756   Visit the Nature Center at Adjacent Brandywine Creek State Park: www.destateparks.com/park/brandywine_creek/index.asp
